item.title: Is Killing Floor 3 Coming To Xbox Game Pass?
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/is-killing-floor-3-coming-to-xbox-game-pass/

Tripwire Interactive’s Killing Floor 3 is another bout of beautiful violence. Eviscerating Zeds and leaving them for dead is the name of the game—well, Killing Floor 3 is. If it’s your first time or you’re a returning fan, here’s the Xbox Game Pass status for the FPS title.

Killing Floor 3 is already testing the waters well ahead of time. The closed beta lets players see what’s new, what works, and what needs fine-tuning. The second installment was fun but had a penchant for repetition, and the third mainline release is looking to be the best yet.

Eventually, Killing Floor 3 will launch, and if it’s on Xbox Game Pass, this is a victory before we even play the game.

Can You Play Killing Floor 3 on Xbox Game Pass?

Xbox Game Pass is not adding Killing Floor 3 to its collection of easily accessible games.

You get access to hundreds of games if you’re a Microsoft Xbox Game Pass subscriber. Many of these arrive as day-one debuts on the Game Pass scheme. However, Killing Floor 3 is not a day-one addition as Tripwire Interactive and Microsoft don’t have an agreement for it to happen.

There’s no mention of Killing Floor 3 coming to Game Pass on its official store page. Nor has the opportunity been mentioned in any trailers, prerelease material, or press releases.

Titles associated with Xbox Game Studios are pretty much day-one Game Pass releases. Any other third-party titles are not guaranteed and it’s up to the two companies to come to an understanding. If not, the game launches of its own accord and it’s up to the publisher to drive sales. In this case, Tripwire Interactive is handling both development and publishing duties, so it’s up to them to generate interest and revenue for KF3.

Will Killing Floor 3 Come to Xbox Game Pass?

It’s uncertain if Killing Floor 3 is coming to Xbox Game Pass at any point.

The closest KF has come to Xbox’s Game Pass subscription service was in 2024 when Killing Floor 2 was offered as a “Free Play Days” promotion. Game Pass users were allowed to sample Killing Floor 2 for a few days. After this, the title went back to being another purchasable option on the Xbox store.

We’ll update this guide if Killing Floor 3 does come to Xbox Game Pass.

Killing Floor 3 looks to be as brutal and painful as its predecessors. Can you envisage yourself losing hundreds of hours lopping off limbs and severing skulls? Or is Killing Floor 3 not your stop?

We have the latest details on several other AAA games and their potential Xbox Game Pass status for you to check out: Atomfall, WWE 2K25, Assassin’s Creed Shadows, Balatro, PGA Tour 2K25, Monster Hunter Wilds, and Split Fiction.

item.title: Pokemon Presents February 2025: Everything Announced
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/pokemon-presents-february-2025-everything-announced/

On Thursday, February 27, The Pokemon Company held its Pokemon Presents event for February 2025. The event coincides with Pokemon Day, a day to honor the original Japanese release of Pokemon Red and Green on February 27, 1996.

While nothing was confirmed for the event, it should be expected that players will get a new look at Pokemon Legends: Z-A, Pokemon Go, Pokemon TCG Pocket, and, possibly, a look at Pokemon gameplay running on Nintendo Switch 2. There is also speculation of a remake of Pokemon Black and White in the works along with the next games in the “Let’s Go” series.

Follow along as everything is announced. Because this is a running article throughout the show, make sure you refresh starting at 9am ET/2pm GMT for everything announced.

And be sure to let us know your thoughts on the showcase in the comments or join the discussion further in the Insider Gaming Forums. It’s worth noting that everything is in the order it was shown.

RELATED: ID@Xbox Showcase February 2025: Everything Announced

Everything Announced At Pokemon Presents For February 2025

Check back as announcements are made during the 2025 Pokemon Presents event.

For more Insider Gaming, read our exclusive interview with a developer responsible for skill-based matchmaking in the Call of Duty franchise.  And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter.
